New Records: Sri Lanka maintained their record of never having lost their first four games in a World Cup since 1987, when they lost all of their games.
Key Match Events: Netherlands' top order collapsed, losing five wickets for 43 runs
Sybrand Engelbrecht and Logan van Beek's 130-run seventh wicket stand was the highest partnership for the seventh wicket or lower at a men's ODI World Cup
Pathum Nissanka hit a fine half-century and Sadeera Samarawickrama steered Sri Lanka to their first win in the World Cup
Aryan Dutt picked three wickets and created a whole bunch of other chances for Netherlands
Pre-Game Insights: Netherlands will be riding the confidence of their stunning win over South Africa, while Sri Lanka are yet to open their account even after three games
Netherlands chose to bat first, a decision that worked for them against South Africa
Sri Lanka made two changes to the side that took the field against Australia, bringing in legspinner Dushan Hemantha and Kasun Rajitha for Dunith Wellalage and Lahiru Kumara
Post-Match Reflections: Samarawickrama says that the wicket was gripping and turning, as was evident, and Sri Lanka planned to take the chase deep, which they did to great effect
Scott Edwards says that Netherlands' top order needs to chip in with more runs
Kusal Mendis is just happy with everyone's contributions to the win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a fairly batting-friendly pitch
Sri Lanka's highest chase against Netherlands was 263
Netherlands' 262 today is their highest total against Sri Lanka, going past the 258 way back in 2006
